intro: Bothriocline shagayuensis, commonly known as the Shagayuensis daisy, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically has hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow or white, arranged in a compact cluster at the tip of the stem. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grassy or rocky habitats.
